titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Grover Batts

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Converted from EAD 2002 to EAD 3 (Release 1.1.1) by ead3_converter_mfer.xsl : Michael Ferrando, Library of Congress.
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Actress and playwright. General correspondence, production material, business records, and other papers concerning Gordon's career in movies and the theater.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Ruth Gordon, actress and playwright, were deposited in the Library of Congress by Gordon in 1969 and converted to a gift and purchase in 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Ruth Gordon Papers were processed in 1972. The finding aid was revised in 2008 and again in 2013.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs have been transferred to the Library's Prints and Photographs Division where they are identified as part of these papers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections in the Manuscript Division include the papers of Gordon's husband, Garson Kanin.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of Ruth Gordon is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Ruth Gordon are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Ruth Gordon Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Ruth Gordon (1896-1985) span the years 1924-1969, with the bulk of the material concentrated between 1940 and 1969. Included in the collection are correspondence, scripts, financial records, and other material relating mainly to the plays and motion pictures in which Gordon appeared. The papers are organized into four series: General Correspondence; Articles, Drama, and Motion Picture File; Financial Records; and Miscellany.

The General Correspondence consists mainly of letters received by Gordon, with only a scattered number of her replies. The correspondence relates primarily to her career as an actress and author and includes a substantial number of letters of particular interest from Edna Ferber, Alex Guinness, Vivien Leigh, Anita Loos, and Robert Morse.

Included in the Articles, Drama, and Motion Picture File are scripts and screenplays (many in sequential drafts that show the evolution of the work into its final form), financial records, publicity material, and reviews of the works. There is also correspondence relating to specific plays and motion pictures. A group of financial records contain Gordon's bank statements and cancelled checks for the years 1937-1957.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in four series:

item.ref: Article, Drama, and Motion Picture File, 1945-1969

scopecontent.p: Mainly letters received with a few replies.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

arrangement.p: Organized by type of work and therein alphabetically by title or type of material.
